Strings.String: Click 'Add' to add a new Alarm.
Click 'Remove' to remove the selected Alarm.
The following keyboard shortcuts are supported by your Sonos System:
The Queue will be saved as a Sonos Playlist.
Or select an existing Sonos Playlist to replace:
The share 'current uses' parameter is invalid.
Unable to remove %s for Guest account.
The share type parameter is invalid.
Unable to load advapi32.dll. LSA settings are unavailable.
The share security descriptor parameter is not valid.
Unable to create Sonos user. Make sure you have Administrator privileges on this computer.
Unable to add the share '%s' with the proper permissions

Network Path Selected.
You cannot select a folder on the network to be shared.
Please select a folder that is on this computer, or an external hard drive connected to this computer.
To select a folder that is shared on your network, click Back and choose "On a networked device…".
The share 'max uses' parameter is invalid.
The share password parameter is not valid.
The share permissions parameter is invalid.
Unable to get share information for %s on %s
Account used by Sonos to access music folders on this computer
Unable to verify share permissions. The unc path %s is not a valid unc path, or not a share on this computer.
Unable to add %s for Guest account.
Unable to add Sonos user to '%s' group
The share remark parameter is invalid.
Are you sure you want to pause the music playing in all rooms?
Use the up and down arrow keys to switch between room groups. Press the space bar to open the grouping dialog.
Use the up and down arrow keys to switch between room groups. Press the space bar to set up this device.
I have read and agree to the terms and conditions
I do not accept the terms and conditions
The Setup Assistant will now help you add your music to the Music Library of your Sonos system.
You can add music from folders on this computer, or folders on your network (such as on an Apple Time Capsule or NAS drive) that are already configured for sharing.
The Setup Assistant has found music in your iTunes media folder.
Do you want to add your iTunes music to your Sonos system?
Do you have any other music, in addition to iTunes, that you want to add to your Sonos system?
Where is the music you'd like to play on Sonos?
The {0} folder is where iTunes® usually stores music.
Your {0} folder has already been added to Sonos.
Another folder or a drive connected to my computer
Please enter the username and password, if any, for the network drive containing your music:
In order for your Sonos system to play music from this computer, the Setup Assistant needs to adjust the following Windows settings:
Add the Sonos Library Service to the Windows Firewall exceptions list. Without these changes, your music on this computer will not play on your Sonos system.
Set Windows sleep settings to Never. Without this change, your music on this computer may not always play on your Sonos system.
Your music is now being added to your Sonos system. This may continue after you start the Sonos Controller, and for large music collections can take several minutes to complete.
You can add additional music in the future from “Manage Music Library” in Settings.
If you want to add music from another computer, please install the Sonos Controller on that computer.
Your Sonos system is already registered.
To view or change any of your registration preferences, please log in to your customer account at %1$s.
To log in, you will need your Sonos account password. Your original password was e-mailed to you when you registered.
Are you sure you want to leave the Setup Assistant?
Sonos was unable to add the music folder
Please check that the path to the folder, and the username and password if needed, are correct.
Could not write to share file
Do you really want to remove the selected folder?
Click ‘Restart’ to restart the controller and continue setup.
Add music from your computer or external drive
Click "Browse" to choose a folder that contains music:
Add music from your networked share
Type the path to your networked share:
"{0}" is now set up on your Sonos system.
Your music is now being added to your Sonos system. This may take several minutes to complete.
You can add music to Sonos in the future from “Manage Music Library” in Settings.
If you want to add music from another computer, please install the Sonos controller on that computer.
Caution: Do not quit the controller application or power down during the update.
After the download completes, the installer will update the controller.
The Sonos controller installer failed to download.
The installer file was not found in the expected location, or the controller does not have permissions to access it.
Your controller did not update successfully. Please try updating one more time. If this message appears again, please contact Sonos Customer Care for assistance.
The Sonos controller failed to install. The rest of the update cannot continue.
The Sonos controller will close and update. After relaunching, the rest of your Sonos system will update.
Sonos is currently running from another account
The Sonos controller is currently running from another user account on your computer.
Please quit the Sonos controller from the other account before installing.
Sonos will adjust your firewall settings. You may be prompted by Windows to allow this change. Please click ‘Yes’ on any Windows confirmation dialogs that open after you click ‘OK’ below.
Your firewall may need to be adjusted.
Click here to configure your firewall

Another folder on this computer is already added to your music library under the name {0}. Please enter a different name so Sonos can distinguish between them. This will not change the actual name of the folder.
Press the Mute and Volume Up buttons at the same time, or press the Join button if your device does not have both Mute and Volume Up buttons.
Path {0} does not exist, cannot create share
To ensure the setup process is successful, your Windows Firewall must be configured for use with Sonos.
Please select "Configure Windows Firewall" and follow the prompts to let Sonos make changes to Windows Firewall.
Your Windows Firewall has been successfully configured.
Your Windows Firewall has not been successfully configured. Please click "{0}" to try again.
If you continue without successfully configuring your Windows Firewall, you may experience problems completing Sonos setup.
You have chosen not to configure your Windows Firewall. If you continue, you may experience problems completing Sonos setup.
Choose music to play in selected room
You currently have no Sonos players in your Sonos system. You need at least one Sonos player to play music.
To add a Sonos player, select Manage > Add a Player or SUB from the menu bar.
You currently have no BOOSTs in your Sonos system.
To add a BOOST, select Manage > Add a BOOST or BRIDGE from the menu bar.
You currently have no DOCKs in your Sonos system.
To add a DOCK, select Manage > Add a Player or SUB from the menu bar.
Click ‘Add’ to add a new service to your Sonos system.
Click ‘Sonos Labs’ to try out upcoming services on your Sonos system.

Strings.String: Click ‘Add’ to add a new music folder to your Sonos system.
Click ‘Remove’ to remove the highlighted folder.
Return to Top Level Music Menu
Scroll to Current Song in Queue
Indexing is currently in progress. Music will be available as soon as indexing completes.
Indexing is currently in progress. Music will be available as soon as indexing completes.
This will update the Music Library of your Sonos System to match any changes you have made in iTunes or other shared music folders. Do you want to update the Music Library of your Sonos system now?
To unhide a room, you must factory reset the Sonos player for that room. For more information, go to {0}
Before you can create an alarm, the current time must be set.
Your computer's firewall setting has changed. Your Sonos controller can no longer connect to your Sonos system.
Click the Configure Firewall button to adjust your firewall settings.
Could not open link: {0}. Please make sure you have a default internet browser set.
To ensure playback from your Music Library, Sonos needs to update the index of songs. This may take a couple of minutes.
There was an error updating your index of songs. Please re-add your music in 'Manage > Music Library Settings…'
To help improve our products and our customer service, Sonos collects information on how you use your Sonos system. To learn more, see
Yes, turn usage data sharing on to help Sonos improve its products.
Equalization settings are not available while a Sonos player's Line-Out level is set to Fixed.
Change the Line-Out level setting on the Basic tab to enable the EQ controls.
Are you sure you want to clear the queue?
Search returned no results for ‘{0}’ in {1}. Please try a different category or a new search term.
Sonos doesn't have enough free space left to save the queue. Remove old saved playlists or queues in other rooms, and try again.
Songs from mobile devices cannot be stored in Sonos Playlists and were not saved.
The queue contains only songs from mobile devices. These songs cannot be saved to Sonos Playlists.
A Sonos Playlist named “{0}” already exists. Replacing it will overwrite its current contents.
Fix permissions on music files so that Sonos can always access them.

Explicit content filtering is enabled. Click the button below to allow explicit content to play on your Sonos system.
Not all services support content filtering.

Explicit content filtering is disabled. Click the button below to prevent explicit content from playing on your Sonos system.
Not all services support content filtering.
There are no music services on your Sonos system that support content filtering.
During music playback, the surround speakers can supplement with subtle, ambient sound or louder, full range sound.
Manually balance your surround levels when Trueplay tuning is turned off.
